title: Where can I go to get royalty free music for my game? - Quora

response.answer_text: The NCS(No copyright sounds) record label is a YouTube channel which posts royalty free music and the tracks there are really good. You can use the music you get there for free, if you properly attribute them to the producers, like they have said in Wikipedia.Their channel link is https://m.youtube.com/user/NoCopyrightSoundsMore information about that channelhttps://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/NoCopyrightSounds Edit:-Another YouTube channel, machinima sound also provides royalty free music from the not so famous artists around the world. Although they don't have a Wikipedia page, their profile from themeforest translates to this "Please note: Our music is registered with YouTube Content ID. What this means is that you may get a so called third-party claim on your video when you upload it to YouTube. This does not mean you will be getting a copyright strike, or that you would be in any sort of trouble. To release the claim on our music, you can use our Content ID claim release form made specifically for Envato Audiojungle customers." Footnotes:-https://themeforest.net/user/machinimasoundTheir YouTube channel:-https://m.youtube.com/channel/UCl-jVSaMOXYIkyC5o9HyNWA
